summary: Aziraphale And Crowley Toast To The World In Good Omens Trailer
title: Aziraphale And Crowley Toast To The World In Good Omens Trailer
body:
Aziraphale And Crowley Toast To The World In Good Omens Trailer

The debut of Amazon’s Good Omensadaptation is still a few months off, but the service has released a proper trailer for the series based on the novel by Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman. In it, angel Aziraphale (Michael Sheen) and demon Crowley (David Tennant) discuss their differences and their options as the Antichrist comes into his power. It is a sign that the end is near. But as both the…

title: 1st Look: 'Good Omens' Full Trailer
body:
1st Look: ‘Good Omens’ Full Trailer

The casting is perfect in the new Amazon Prime trailer for Good Omens .

Leading the cast are two recognizable faces.  David Tennant (Doctor Who) is Crowley, a demon who did not so much fall as saunter vaguely downwards, who loves scalding-hot showers and driving his Bentley far too fast.  As his opposite number, Aziraphale,…

blog.description:
Bi. Feminist. Multifandom. Obsessed with Alex Kingston and CAOS women. Praise Satan! Gay for River Song & Thirteen. Have soft spot for everything David Tennant. Totally shipping Crowley & Aziraphael. Middle aged women in suit, Carrie Fisher and the Fab Five are guiding my life. 
Follow me on Insta.

excerpt: Good Omens has an all-star cast that includes David Tennant, Michael Sheen and Benedict Cumberbatch
description:
The type of project Michael Sheen does, so the writing on Prodigal Son should be considerably better than we Chris Wood fans have experienced recently.

I would love to see what Chris Wood could do with really good material…

summary: David Tennant and Michael Sheen team up to save the world in the 'Good Omens' trailer
title: David Tennant and Michael Sheen team up to save the world in the 'Good Omens' trailer
body:
David Tennant and Michael Sheen team up to save the world from imminent apocalypse in the official trailer for new Amazon Video adaption, Good Omens.

Based on the 1990 novel by Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman, who also wrote the television adaption, the show will see an angel played by Sheen and a demon played by Tennant forced to team up to find the anti-christ and stop Armageddon. Along the way the pair encounter creatures from heaven, hell, and a few humans who help and hinder their quest.

The show also features a top-notch cast, including  Jon Hamm as archangel Gabriel, Frances McDormand as the voice of God, and Benedict Cumberbatch as the voice of Satan.

Read more: Benedict Cumberbatch to play Satan in Good Omens

In a recent interview with Variety, Gaiman said that the process of bringing his novel to screen took two years and that he only did it because it was co-author Pratchett’s dying wish.

“I didn’t in any real sense of the word have two years of my life to give up to make this, so I wouldn’t have done it if Terry hadn’t died and given me this as his last request.”

And if star David Tennant is to be trusted, the series promises to entertain. He told the Guardian in an interview last month that the series promises to be, “Absurdly good fun.”

Here’s the synopsis: Good Omens is based on the beloved book by Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman which follows an unlikely duo, a fussy Angel (Michael Sheen, Masters of Sex) and a loose-living Demon (David Tennant, Doctor Who) who’ve become overly fond of life on Earth are forced to form an unlikely alliance to stop Armageddon. But they have lost the Antichrist, an 11-year-old boy unaware he’s meant to bring upon the end of days, forcing them to embark on an adventure to find him and save the world before it’s too late.

Good Omens will be released in its entirety on Amazon Video on 31 May.

Based on the 1990 novel by Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman, who also wrote the television adaption, the show will see an angel played by Sheen and a demon played by Tennant forced to team up to find the anti-christ and stop Armageddon. Along the way the pair encounter creatures from heaven, hell, and a few humans who help and hinder their quest.

The show also features a top-notch cast, including  Jon Hamm as archangel Gabriel, Frances McDormand as the voice of God, and Benedict Cumberbatch as the voice of Satan.

Read more: Benedict Cumberbatch to play Satan in Good Omens

In a recent interview with Variety, Gaiman said that the process of bringing his novel to screen took two years and that he only did it because it was co-author Pratchett’s dying wish.

And if star David Tennant is to be trusted, the series promises to entertain. He told the Guardian in an interview last month that the series promises to be, “Absurdly good fun.”

trail.content:
David Tennant and Michael Sheen in Good Omens (Amazon)

David Tennant and Michael Sheen team up to save the world from imminent apocalypse in the official trailer for new Amazon Video adaption, Good Omens.

Based on the 1990 novel by Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman, who also wrote the television adaption, the show will see an angel played by Sheen and a demon played by Tennant forced to team up to find the anti-christ and stop Armageddon. Along the way the pair encounter creatures from heaven, hell, and a few humans who help and hinder their quest.

The show also features a top-notch cast, including  Jon Hamm as archangel Gabriel, Frances McDormand as the voice of God, and Benedict Cumberbatch as the voice of Satan.

Read more: Benedict Cumberbatch to play Satan in Good Omens

In a recent interview with Variety, Gaiman said that the process of bringing his novel to screen took two years and that he only did it because it was co-author Pratchett’s dying wish.

“I didn’t in any real sense of the word have two years of my life to give up to make this, so I wouldn’t have done it if Terry hadn’t died and given me this as his last request.”

And if star David Tennant is to be trusted, the series promises to entertain. He told the Guardian in an interview last month that the series promises to be, “Absurdly good fun.”

Here’s the synopsis: Good Omens is based on the beloved book by Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman which follows an unlikely duo, a fussy Angel (Michael Sheen, Masters of Sex) and a loose-living Demon (David Tennant, Doctor Who) who’ve become overly fond of life on Earth are forced to form an unlikely alliance to stop Armageddon. But they have lost the Antichrist, an 11-year-old boy unaware he’s meant to bring upon the end of days, forcing them to embark on an adventure to find him and save the world before it’s too late.

Good Omens will be released in its entirety on Amazon Video on 31 May.

summary:
Good Omens - Official Trailer | Prime Video

  

With Armageddon just days away, the armies of Heaven and Hell are amassing and...
caption:
Good Omens - Official Trailer | Prime Video

With Armageddon just days away, the armies of Heaven and Hell are amassing and The Four Horsemen are ready to ride. Aziraphale, an angel, and Crowley, a demon, agree to join forces to find the missing Anti-Christ and to stop the war that will end everything. Based on the best-selling novel by Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman, Good Omens follows an unlikely duo and their quest to save the world. New Series premiere May 31, 2019.

blog.description: A cornucopia of fandoms alongside liberal politics. I mean *lefty fuckin' capital-L Liberal*, not "weaksauce center right that passes for liberal because today's American conservatives make Nixon look like a Goddamn hippie." If you don't want to see those posts, block the tag "Fuck the GOP." Also, I swear a lot.

summary: Dear everyone involved over at Amazon media programming, Thank you so much for giving me the Good Omens series premiere as my...
caption:
Dear everyone involved over at Amazon media programming,

Thank you so much for giving me the Good Omens series premiere as my birthday present! Unfortunately, I will be unable to attend, as I have a previous commitment to put Raúl Esparza in my FACE, but it’s nice to know you were thinking of me. 

I promise I will open your thoughtful gift the very next day!

Love, 

tzikeh
